ygData.subject: Re: Numb The Dead - Just a quick question
ygData.msgSnippet: Once you tick the creature off, numb isn t going to do a whole lot, it s a preventative spell, say there are 2 skele s that you want to take down, but you can
ygData.messageBody:
Once you tick the creature off, numb isn't going to do a whole lot, it's a
preventative spell, say there are 2 skele's that you want to take down, but
you can only take one at a time. numb one so it won't attack you while you
kill the other one. Be careful though, more often than not the spell will
fail when you most need it and both mobs will be angry at you.

-Mark

----- Original Message -----
From: Shadow Panther <shdwpanther@...>
To: <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, May 11, 1999 9:57 AM
Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Numb The Dead - Just a quick question


> From: "Shadow Panther" <shdwpanther@...>
>
>
> Simple question about this one. When is it effective and when is it
> not? I cast it on some skeletons that were attacking others in Befallen,
> and it said that it appeared...well, I forget the word that it uses, but
it
> was successful. However the creature continued to smack the player
around.
>
> So.. does it slow the attacks, or just not work while it's fighting
and
> just needs to be cast on the creature while it's still just standing or
> wandering around? Or would it have been something else that immediatly
> ticked it off again? The player, in one instance, was just running and
not
> swinging back. I didn't have enough for a Ward nor wanted to chance
ticking
> it off and being smacked around myself. Thanks folks.
>
> ~Mysk
>
